events.message: The applicant has submitted their mortgage loan application to purchase a new house in the suburbs.
The loan application has been categorised as a mortgage loan for home purchase purposes.
A dedicated loan officer has been assigned to manage and assist with the mortgage loan application.
The initial review of the applicant’s credit history and income documents has been started.
Additional property ownership and income verification documents have been requested from the applicant.
The applicant has submitted all the requested documents, including property appraisal and bank statements.
The credit check process has been completed and the applicant’s credit score meets the minimum requirement.
Risk assessment indicates the applicant is a low risk borrower for the mortgage loan based on financial stability.
A formal mortgage loan offer including interest rates and repayment schedule has been presented to the applicant.
The applicant has reviewed the mortgage offer and provided positive feedback, expressing their intent to proceed.
The mortgage loan application has been approved by the credit committee following all successful checks.
The approved mortgage loan funds have been disbursed to the applicant’s escrow account for property purchase.
A post-approval follow-up call was conducted to ensure the applicant is satisfied and aware of payment schedules.
The mortgage loan application case has been officially closed after successful funding and confirmation with the client.
